page.title: 20MARLBOROUGH COLLEGE TODAY
page.content:
In general, boys enter this totally boarding Public School at the age of 13. Girls, since 1968 and further boys are accepted in the sixth form (A level years). Roughly 150 full time staff teach and care for 760 boys and 100 girls, who are accomodated in 15 boarding houses.
Approximately 70% gain a University place, of whom 20% reach Oxford or Cambridge. The rest largely go on to other forms of further education or the forces.
About half the parents of students are in the professions and the other half in business; as far as can be told, the students follow roughly the same pattern in their own careers.
